stories.headline: To Have or to Have Not
stories.summary: Thompson explores how the Gini index can be used to measure income inequality across the United States, analyzing income data and exploring socioeconomic trends contributing to inequality.

stories.headline: Collision Course
stories.summary: Linsk investigates the increase in fatal road accidents involving older drivers using the Fatal Accident Reporting System, focusing on demographic changes and safety implications in New Jersey.

stories.headline: Wire Service Serves CAR
stories.summary: Sowell reports on efforts by the Associated Press to improve computer-assisted reporting across its bureaus, highlighting technological upgrades and the potential for detailed investigative journalism.

stories.headline: Internet Travel Assistance
stories.summary: Paul provides tips on using internet resources for travel research, including finding maps, city guides, flight information, and accommodations, for journalists on the go.

stories.headline: CAR Goes on Field Trip
stories.summary: Bush describes her investigation into disparities in school field trip funding between affluent and poorer districts, highlighting the challenges of data collection and analysis.
